snippet: Jack Ma began his career as an English teacher. Today, two of his websites account for more than half of the packages shipped through China’s postal system.
abstract: Alibaba is moving forward with plans for stock sale that, if successful, would vault company and founder Jack Ma to the highest ranks of technology industry titans; Ma has no background in computing, unlike other dot-com billionaires, and his role has been company's main strategist, flamboyant motivator in chief to his staff and relentless opponent to those who have competed against him.

byline.original: By NEIL GOUGH and ALEXANDRA STEVENSON
byline.contributor: Neil Gough reported from Hong Kong, and Alexandra Stevenson from New York. Shanshan Wang contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Jack Ma began his career as an English teacher. Today, two of his websites account for more than half of the packages shipped through China’s postal system.

headline.main: The Unlikely Ascent of Jack Ma, Alibaba’s Founder
headline.print_headline: The Rise of Alibaba, and a Tycoon
